description: Decision making criteria for shaping behavior

criteria.question: How are we identifying and defining bounded contexts?
criteria.outcome: Determines how domain boundaries are established
options: By business capability - group by what the business does
By organizational structure - align with teams or departments
By data ownership - group by who owns the data
By integration patterns - group by how systems interact
By domain complexity - separate complex from simple domains

criteria.question: What level of domain acceptance criteria should be explored for structure-focused areas?
criteria.outcome: Determines whether to explore only domain acceptance criteria or include business acceptance criteria
options: Behavioral -> Explore Business and Domain AC
criteria.note: Structure focuses on domain structure and relationships. Behavioral includes business behavior and outcomes.
